title: Homer - Divine Invocation
original_text: μῆνιν ἄειδε θεά
english_translation: Sing, goddess, the wrath
grammar_notes: Imperative mood; vocative case; accusative direct object
cultural_context: Famous opening of the Iliad, invoking the Muse to sing of Achilles' anger
author: Homer

title: Homer - Heroic Epithet
original_text: πόδας ὠκὺς Ἀχιλλεύς
english_translation: swift-footed Achilles
grammar_notes: Accusative of respect; epic epithet formula; nominative subject
cultural_context: Common Homeric epithet for Achilles, emphasizing his speed in battle
author: Homer

title: Homer - Divine Epithet
original_text: Φοῖβος Ἀπόλλων
english_translation: Phoebus Apollo
grammar_notes: Apposition; divine epithet; nominative case
cultural_context: Standard epithet for Apollo, god of prophecy and archery
author: Homer

title: Herodotus - Historical Opening
original_text: Ἡροδότου Ἁλικαρνησσέος
english_translation: of Herodotus of Halicarnassus
grammar_notes: Genitive of possession; geographical designation
cultural_context: Opening identification formula from Herodotus' Histories
author: Herodotus

title: Homer - Epic Formula
original_text: ἔπεα πτερόεντα προσηύδα
english_translation: he spoke winged words
grammar_notes: Aorist indicative; accusative direct object; epic formula
cultural_context: Common Homeric phrase for beginning speech, suggesting words fly to their target
author: Homer

title: Homer - Divine Council
original_text: Διὸς δ' ἐτελείετο βουλή
english_translation: and the will of Zeus was fulfilled
grammar_notes: Imperfect passive; genitive of possession; postpositive particle
cultural_context: Key thematic phrase showing divine plan controlling events of the Trojan War
author: Homer

title: Herodotus - Historical Purpose
original_text: ἱστορίης ἀπόδεξις
english_translation: the display of inquiry
grammar_notes: Genitive of material; nominative subject
cultural_context: Herodotus' statement of purpose - presenting results of research
author: Herodotus

title: Homer - Epic Epithet
original_text: ἄναξ ἀνδρῶν Ἀγαμέμνων
english_translation: lord of men, Agamemnon
grammar_notes: Genitive of relation; apposition; epic formula
cultural_context: Standard epithet for Agamemnon, emphasizing his authority
author: Homer

title: Homer - Divine Anger
original_text: χωόμενος κῆρ
english_translation: angry in heart
grammar_notes: Present participle; accusative of respect
cultural_context: Epic description of emotional state, often of gods
author: Homer

title: Herodotus - Persian Account
original_text: Περσέων οἱ λόγιοι
english_translation: the learned Persians
grammar_notes: Partitive genitive; attributive position of adjective
cultural_context: Herodotus citing Persian sources for his historical accounts
author: Herodotus

title: Homer - Warriors Assembly
original_text: λαὸν ἄγειρε
english_translation: he gathered the army
grammar_notes: Imperfect active; accusative direct object
author: Homer

title: Homer - Epic Navigation
original_text: νηυσὶ θοῇσι
english_translation: in/with swift ships
grammar_notes: Dative of means/instrument; attributive adjective
cultural_context: Standard epic phrase for sea travel
author: Homer

title: Herodotus - Truth Verification
original_text: τὰ λεγόμενα
english_translation: the things being said
grammar_notes: Substantive participle; present passive
author: Herodotus

title: Homer - Divine Protection
original_text: θεοὶ ῥύοντο
english_translation: the gods protected
grammar_notes: Imperfect middle voice; divine intervention formula
author: Homer

title: Homer - Heroic Greeting
original_text: χαῖρε ἄναξ
english_translation: hail, lord
grammar_notes: Imperative mood; vocative of address
cultural_context: Formal greeting to royalty or superiors
author: Homer

title: Herodotus - Geographical Description
original_text: ποταμὸς ῥέει
english_translation: a/the river flows
grammar_notes: Present indicative active; intransitive verb
author: Herodotus

title: Homer - Epic Journey
original_text: ἐς Τροίην
english_translation: to Troy
grammar_notes: Preposition with accusative; direction toward
author: Homer

title: Homer - Divine Action
original_text: θεὰ ἔδωκε
english_translation: the goddess gave
grammar_notes: Aorist active indicative; divine gift formula
author: Homer

title: Herodotus - Historical Causation
original_text: τοῦδε ἕνεκα
english_translation: for this reason
vocabulary: [{"word": "τοῦδε", "meaning": "of this (genitive demonstrative)"}, {"word": "ἕνεκα", "meaning": "because of, for the sake of (preposition)"}]
grammar_notes: Genitive with ἕνεκα; causal expression
author: Herodotus

title: Homer - Battle Description
original_text: μάχην συνέηκε
english_translation: he joined battle
grammar_notes: Aorist active; military action formula
cultural_context: Standard phrase for engaging in combat
author: Homer

title: Homer - Sacrificial Formula
original_text: ἱερὰ καλὰ
english_translation: beautiful/favorable sacrifices
grammar_notes: Attributive adjective position; religious formula
author: Homer

title: Herodotus - Ethnic Designation
original_text: οἱ Ἕλληνες
english_translation: the Greeks
grammar_notes: Definite article with proper noun; collective ethnic designation
author: Herodotus

title: Homer - Epic Simile Opening
original_text: ὡς δ' ὅτε
english_translation: and as when
grammar_notes: Comparative conjunction; temporal clause introducer
author: Homer

title: Homer - Warrior Description
original_text: ἀνὴρ ἀγαθός
english_translation: a good/brave man
grammar_notes: Predicative adjective; ethical-military virtue
author: Homer

title: Herodotus - Temporal Marker
original_text: μετὰ δὲ ταῦτα
english_translation: and after these things
grammar_notes: Prepositional phrase; sequential narrative marker
author: Herodotus

title: Homer - Divine Intervention
original_text: θεὸς ὤπασε
english_translation: a god granted
grammar_notes: Aorist active; divine benefaction formula
author: Homer

title: Homer - Time Expression
original_text: νυκτὸς ἀμολγῷ
english_translation: at milking time of night
grammar_notes: Genitive of time; dative of time when
author: Homer

title: Herodotus - Reported Speech
original_text: λέγεται ὧδε
english_translation: it is said thus
vocabulary: [{"word": "λέγεται", "meaning": "it is said (present passive)"}, {"word": "ὧδε", "meaning": "thus, in this way (adverb)"}]
grammar_notes: Present passive indicative; evidential formula
author: Herodotus

title: Homer - Emotional Response
original_text: φρένες ἔστενον
english_translation: his heart/mind groaned
grammar_notes: Imperfect active; psychological description
author: Homer

title: Herodotus - Causal Statement
original_text: διὰ ταύτην τὴν αἰτίην
english_translation: because of this cause
grammar_notes: Preposition with accusative; causal expression
author: Herodotus

title: Herodotus - Historical Opening
original_text: Ἡροδότου Ἁλικαρνησσέος ἱστορίης ἀπόδεξις ἥδε
english_translation: This is the display of the inquiry of Herodotus of Halicarnassus
vocabulary: [{"word": "Ἡροδότου", "meaning": "of Herodotus (genitive)"}, {"word": "Ἁλικαρνησσέος", "meaning": "of Halicarnassus (genitive)"}, {"word": "ἱστορίης", "meaning": "of inquiry, research (genitive)"}, {"word": "ἀπόδεξις", "meaning": "display, presentation (nominative)"}, {"word": "ἥδε", "meaning": "this (nominative feminine demonstrative)"}]
grammar_notes: Genitive of possession; demonstrative pronoun; predicate nominative
cultural_context: Famous opening of Herodotus' Histories, establishing authorial voice
author: Herodotus

title: Homer - Epic Prayer
original_text: κλῦθί μευ ἀργυρότοξ᾽, ὃς Χρύσην ἀμφιβέβηκας
english_translation: Hear me, silver-bowed one, who protects Chryse
grammar_notes: Aorist imperative; genitive object of verb; relative clause; perfect tense
cultural_context: Chryses' prayer to Apollo for vengeance against the Greeks
author: Homer

title: Herodotus - Intermediate Passage 33
original_text: οἱ δὲ Πέρσαι λέγουσι τὴν αἰτίην γενέσθαι τοιήνδε
english_translation: but the Persians say the cause happened thus
grammar_notes: Main clause with subordinate elements; demonstrative pronouns
author: Herodotus

title: Homer - Intermediate Passage 34
original_text: τοὺς δὲ μετὰ Τρώων προμάχους ἴδεν ἀντιθέοιο
english_translation: and he saw them among the Trojan champions, godlike
grammar_notes: Main clause with subordinate elements; demonstrative pronouns
author: Homer
